solution_line_template: First, Stephanie needs to figure out how many cups of soy sauce she needs total, {first_recipe_cups} cups + {second_recipe_cups} cup + {third_recipe_cups} cups = <<{first_recipe_cups}+{second_recipe_cups}+{third_recipe_cups}={total_cups_needed}>>{total_cups_needed} cups total of lower sodium soy sauce.

Then Stephanie needs to figure out how many ounces are in {total_cups_needed} cups of lower sodium soy sauce, {total_cups_needed} x {ounces_per_cup} ounces each cup = <<{total_cups_needed}*{ounces_per_cup}={total_ounces_needed}>>{total_ounces_needed} total ounces of lower sodium soy sauce.

Next Stephanie needs to figure out how many bottles of soy sauce to purchase to get {total_ounces_needed} ounces, where 1 bottle has {ounces_per_bottle} ounces, {total_ounces_needed} / {ounces_per_bottle} = <<{total_ounces_needed}/{ounces_per_bottle}={bottles_to_buy}>>{bottles_to_buy} bottles of lower sodium soy sauce.
